# Attachment

**Structure**

A type describing values that can be attached to the output of a test run and inspected later by the user.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Attachment<AttachableValue> where AttachableValue : Attachable, AttachableValue : ~Copyable
```

## Overview

Attachments are included in test reports in Xcode or written to disk when tests are run at the command line. To create an attachment, you need a value of some type that conforms to [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/Attachable]. Initialize an instance of [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/Attachment] with that value and, optionally, a preferred filename to use when writing to disk.

## Initializers

- **init(_:named:sourceLocation:)**: Initialize an instance of this type that encloses the given attachable value.
- **init(contentsOf:named:sourceLocation:)**: Initialize an instance of this type with the contents of the given URL.

## Instance Properties

- **attachableValue**: The value of this attachment.
- **attachableValue**: The value of this attachment.
- **preferredName**: A filename to use when writing this attachment to a test report or to a file on disk.

## Instance Methods

- **withUnsafeBytes(_:)**: Call a function and pass a buffer representing the value of this instance’s [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/Attachment/attachableValue-2tnj5] property to it.

## Type Methods

- **record(_:named:sourceLocation:)**: Attach a value to the current test.
- **record(_:sourceLocation:)**: Attach an attachment to the current test.

## Default Implementations

- **CustomStringConvertible Implementations**

## Attaching values to tests

- **Attachable**: A protocol describing a type that can be attached to a test report or written to disk when a test is run.
- **AttachableWrapper**: A protocol describing a type that can be attached to a test report or written to disk when a test is run and which contains another value that it stands in for.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
